intro: Harpagophytum peglerae, commonly known as the peacock ginger, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. The plant has fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that help it survive in dry environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in terminal spikes. Harpagophytum peglerae is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory effects.
